data.text:
University of Derby Services for International Students

The University offers a range of support services, advice and social activities which will help you settle smoothly into life in the UK. Expert teams can provide practical help and advice with questions around finance and budgeting, study skills and living and working in the UK.

The University runs a pickup service from selected airports for new international starters, and this is followed up by an induction program which takes place in the week before term begins.

The university also provides a wealth of free and confidential support for students’ health and wellbeing – this includes helping students juggle competing demands, taking care of mental health, supporting students with disabilities and specific learning differences, and advice for mature students and student parents.

Personal tutors provide advice and guidance as students progress through their studies, and additional study support is available, including English language tuition.

Fees and Finance

All international students who are studying on campus will pay international student fees. Most international fees are £14,900 per year for 2023/2024.

The most up-to-date fees will be listed on the course page – search for your course and look for the section on fees.

Scholarships

The University of Derby has a range of scholarships and discounts available to international students. These offer a reduction in fees during the first year of study. Some scholarships are automatically awarded to eligible students; for others you will need to submit an application form once you have an offer to study at Derby.

Students must be applying for a full-time degree. Applications for postgraduate research, online studies, foundation and pre-sessional language programmes are not eligible for a discount or scholarship.

Scholarships open to international students include:

Vice-Chancellor’s Scholarship

International Excellent Student Scholarship

GREAT Scholarship

Commonwealth Shared Scholarship

There are also a number of sports scholarships open to international students. Full details about scholarships, including terms and conditions, are available here.

Apply for University of Derby

SI-UK can help you apply to study University of Derby in the UK. Arrange your free consultation online or at our London office today.

University of Derby Accommodation

You will discover secure, affordable accommodation in the University of Derby’s award-winning halls of residence where you will be provided with a free arrival pack, bed pack and kitchen pack as soon as you arrive. They include essential items of food, cutlery and bedding. With all bills included in rent, you don’t need to worry about paying extra for gas, electricity or WiFi, helping you to budget.

Derby's halls of residence are owned and run by the University so you can be sure of good quality accommodation - a real home from home. Voted Best University Housing (Global Student Living Awards UK & Ireland 2022), there are lots of options to suit your preferences and budget.

Halls are the ideal place for you to live during your time at University as they’re a great place to make friends - and the good news is that you can live in halls throughout your studies if you want to.

Most first year students live in halls. They're just a short walk from our campuses and a great place to make friends and settle into University life.

Halls offer you safe, good-value accommodation in convenient locations with some added extras, like an awesome events programme and weekly cleaning service. Derby was voted Best Moving In Experience (Global Student Living Awards UK & Ireland 2022), thanks to its friendly and welcoming team.

Derby guarantee a room in halls to all first year and overseas students who make the University of Derby their first choice and apply for accommodation by July each year.
